main event: An unidentified object was sighted in Tempe, Arizona on January 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was first observed at an altitude of 2000 feet before descending to 500 feet., It appeared to be elliptical in shape, approximately 30 feet in diameter., The object emitted no exhaust, left no trail, and made no sound., It was able to accelerate rapidly and departed at a high rate of speed., Another sighting occurred on January 12, 1957, where a shiny object the size of a half dollar was observed stationary at a distance of 30 to 40 feet.
witness description: 2nd Lt., USAFR, Pilot and Mr. and Mrs. Richard Schroeder
